briefdescription.para: The interval, in seconds, between recording frames for player objects during a replay recording session. Determines the frequency at which player transform data is captured.

Defines the interval, in seconds, at which normal objects are recorded during the replay session. This variable determines the frequency of data collection, where a smaller value increases the recording frequency (capturing more frames) and a larger value reduces it, optimizing performance. Default value is set to 0.1 seconds, equivalent to 10 FPS for normal objects, aiming for a balance between recording detail and computational efficiency.
Represents a collection of recording data for all rigidbodies currently being tracked during a replay session.

detaileddescription.para: This list stores instances of RigidbodyRecordingData, which contains data about the position, rotation, and other relevant physics states of rigidbodies over a period of time. It is used during recording to collect data, during saving to write the data to a replay session, and during playback to replay the recorded object's state changes.

briefdescription.para: Indicates whether the replay recording process is currently active.

detaileddescription.para: This variable is set to true when recording starts and is set to false when the recording stops.

briefdescription.para: Holds the start time of the recording process, represented in seconds since the start of the application. This value is used to calculate the duration of a recording session by subtracting it from the current time when the recording is in progress, or from the end time once the recording is stopped.

The timestamp indicating when the recording session ended, expressed in seconds since the start of the application run. This variable is updated when the recording process is stopped and serves as the end point for calculating the total recording duration.
Represents the time in seconds of the last recorded frame for the player's Rigidbody during an active recording session.

detaileddescription.para: This value is reset to 0 when a recording session starts and is updated during each recording cycle. It is used to track the time elapsed since the last player's Rigidbody frame was recorded.

briefdescription.para: Stores the last recorded timestamp for normal objects during the recording process.

detaileddescription.para: This variable is used internally by the ReplayRecorder class to track the time of the most recent recording update for normal (non-player) objects. It is reset to 0 when recording starts, and updated dynamically during the recording session to ensure accurate timing data is captured.

briefdescription.para: Indicates whether the recorder is currently in the process of recording.
Gets the duration of the current recording session in seconds.

detaileddescription.para: The duration is calculated as the difference between the current time and the start time if a recording is in progress. If the recording has stopped, it returns the duration between the start and end times of the last recorded session.
A floating-point value representing the duration of the recording in seconds.

briefdescription.para: Gets the number of objects currently being recorded.

detaileddescription.para: This property reflects the total count of objects that are actively included in the current recording session.

briefdescription.para: Gets the singleton instance of the ReplayRecorder class. If no instance exists, a new object will be instantiated and persisted across scenes.

detaileddescription.para: The Instance property ensures a single global instance of the ReplayRecorder class, utilizing lazy initialization. If accessed for the first time and no instance exists, it creates a new GameObject named "ReplayRecorder" and attaches the ReplayRecorder component to it.

briefdescription.para: Singleton instance of the ReplayRecorder class, providing global access to the replay recording functionality.

detaileddescription.para: Initializes the ReplayRecorder instance and ensures only one instance exists at a time. If no instance exists, it assigns the current object as the instance and marks it to not be destroyed on scene load. If an instance already exists that is not the current object, the current object will be destroyed. <return>Void.</return>

Updates the recording data for the current frame during an active recording session. This method captures and stores frame data for player objects and normal objects based on their respective recording intervals. It ensures that data is only recorded during an active recording session and while the application is running. If the recording session is inactive, or the application is not in play mode, this method exits without performing any operations.
No value is returned, as this method performs its operations directly on the recording data maintained by the ReplayRecorder instance.

briefdescription.para: Starts the recording process for specified rigidbodies.

parameterdescription.para: A list of Rigidbody objects considered as player-controlled objects.
A list of Rigidbody objects considered as non-player-controlled objects.

detaileddescription.para:
Stops the current recording process if it is ongoing. Resets the recording status and records the final duration of the recording for reference. No effect if recording is not active.
Void. There is no return value for this method.

Saves the current recording session as a replay session.
sessionName
The name to assign to the replay session. If not provided, the session will remain unnamed.
A ReplaySession object containing the saved recording data. Returns null if no recording data exists.

Clears all current recording data and resets the recording state. This method stops any ongoing recording, clears the stored recorded data, and resets the internal recording start and end time to their initial values.
Void. No value is returned.

briefdescription.para: Retrieves the current recording data as a list of rigidbody recording entries.

simplesect.para: A list of RigidbodyRecordingData containing the recording data collected during the current recording session. Returns an empty list if no recording data is available.

detaileddescription.para:
Checks if the current recording contains any valid recorded data.
true if there is at least one object with recorded frames; otherwise, false.

briefdescription.para: Handles the recording of Rigidbody and Transform data for replay functionality. Manages the initiation, termination, and data management of a recording session.
